page.title: 07FARMING
page.content: A CASE STUDY OF A LOCAL FARM... A 300 ACRE LOCAL FARM HAS BEEN OWNED BY THE KEELER FAMILY FOR THREE GENERATIONS IN MILL LANE , HORSFORD.IT IS TYPICAL OF THE AREA AND INCLUDES 60 ACRES OF GRASSLAND AND 5 OF MEADOW. MAIN CROPS ARE; FODDER, SUGAR BEET, SPRING AND WINTER BARLEY AND 10 ACRES OF POTATOES. THE LAND IS FARMED BY 2 RENAULT & 2 JOHN DEERE TRACTORS, 7 TEN TON TRAILERS, 1 CORNMILL, 3 HAYTURNERS , 1 SPREADER, 1 COMBINE, 1 PLOUGHPRESS AND 1 ROUND BALER. MRS. KEELER & HER FATHER IN LAW MANAGE THE 700 SHEEP WHOSE WOOL IS SENT TO THE CENTRAL WOOL GROWERS, STAMFORD, AND MEAT TO F.M.C.. THE MEN TEND THE 60 FREESIAN COWS AND 2 BULLS. THE ONLY NON FAMILY MEMBERS TEND THE 100 SOWS AND 2 PIGS.FATTENED PIGLETS ARE SOLD AT 12 WEEKS.THEY ALSO HAVE 5 DOGS AND MRS KEELER SENIOR CARES FOR A BROOD OF CHICKENS.
